title: Eight things to know about Gopal Baglay, External Affairs Ministry’s new spokesperson- The New Indian Express
text:
Eight things to know about Gopal Baglay, External Affairs Ministry’s new spokesperson By Online Desk | Published: 27th February 2017 08:42 PM | Last Updated: 27th February 2017 09:28 PM | A+ A A- | 0 Share Via Email Outgoing spokesperson of MEA, Vikas Swarup welcomes Gopal Baglay. (Twitter/ @MEAIndia) Successor to Vikas Swarup, Gopal Baglay was a Joint Secretary in the Pakistan, Afghanistan, Iran (PAI) division of the Ministry of External Affairs, before he officially took charge as spokesperson of MEA on February 27. 
Baglay joined the Indian Foreign Service (IFS) in 1992 after completing a Masters in Chemistry from Lucknow University. 
The Ministry of External Affairs has been Baglay’s home for more than a decade, before which he has represented India as it’s envoy in embassies abroad, including Moscow and Kiev, apart from the High Commission in London. 
Fluent in Hindi, Urdu, English and Nepali , Gopal Baglay can also communicate in Ukranian and Russian. 
Gopal Bagley has had engagaements at various sensitive Indian outposts, including in the post-Soviet Union era, first in Kiev, Ukraine between 1994 and 1996, and soon after in neighbouring Russia, from 1996 to 1999, where he was second secretary at India’s Embassy in Moscow. 
After his stint in the foreign services in the embassy of India’s most important ally at the time, Baglay served as special assistant to the High Commissioner in London from 1999 to 2002 and as First Secretary (Economic) from 2002 to 2005. 
He has also had an appointment in the UN and held the post of Counsellor (Press, Information & Culture), Embassy of India, Kathmandu from 2005 to 2008, at a time when our Himalayan neighbour was transitioning from a Maoist-troubled monarchy to a democracy. 
Soon after, Gopal Bagley was given another sensitive assignment, as Deputy High Commissioner in Islamabad from 2011 to 2014, after which he graduated to the role of Joint Secretary dealing with Pakistan, Afghanistan and Iran in the Ministry of External Affairs, and has now been named spokesperson of the MEA.
